where h denotes the species occurrence vector and σ 2 and μ are the respective variance and mean. As before, we calculated for each species the linear regression slopes z VMR between annual VMR values and study years. According to our first research question, we expected to see a temporal increase in altitudinal range size. For statistical inference, we used ordinary least squares linear regression and general linear modelling. To answer our second research question, we used general linear modelling to refer mean altitudinal occurrences, z alt, z range, z VMR, and z skew (response variables) to species dispersal ability as well as the degrees of specialisation and endangerment (predictors).
